data.title: James Newton Howard, BTS Hans Zimmer & Name Th
data.meta_description: SCORE: THE PODCAST welcomes James Newton Howard, Oscar-nominated and Grammy Award-winning composer of films including Pretty Woman, The Fugitive, The Sixth Sens
data.text:
Score: The Podcast welcomes James Newton Howard, Oscar-nominated and Grammy Award-winning composer of films including Pretty Woman, The Fugitive, The Sixth Sense, Treasure Planet, Signs, The Village, King Kong, Blood Diamond, Michael Clayton, Defiance, Batman Begins & The Dark Knight, The Hunger Games series, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them and most recently Red Sparrow.

Robert and Kenny begin the show discussing the score-only release of Star Wars: The Last Jedi, which is a major indicator that audiences are expressing more interest than ever in the music of entertainment. Robert and Kenny discuss how the music of "Atlanta" and "The Chi" are evolving hip hop in music.

James Newton Howard talks about working with M. Night Shyamalan on "Signs," Hans Zimmer on Batman Begins and The Dark Knight and scoring Peter Jackson's King Kong via video conference in four and a half weeks.

In "Behind the Score," Hans Zimmer talks about the importance of capturing the first few frames of a movie to set its musical tone. Lastly, the guys play a Danny Elfman-themed edition of the game "Name That Score," where you — yes, you — can be a winner!

FOLLOW @ScoreThePodcast http://twitter.com/ScoreThePodcast

Hosts: Robert Kraft and Kenny Holmes.

Executive Producer: Matt Schrader.

Copyright 2018 Epicleff Media

Review on iPhone or iPad

1. Launch the Apple Podcasts app.

2. Tap the Search tab (on the bottom right) and enter “Score: The Podcast” in the search. Look for the SCORE logo to appear.

3. Select Score: The Podcast, and then tap the Reviews tab.

4. Tap Write a Review at the bottom.

5. Before pressing Send, take a screenshot of your review by pressing the Home and Power buttons on your iPhone at the same time. This is your proof of entry to win an autographed copy of SCORE: A FILM MUSIC DOCUMENTARY. (Be sure you remember to hit Send after!)

(Optional) 6. Tweet us your screenshot @ScorethePodcast. This way we’ll be able to contact you through Twitter, as the Podcasts app does not allow us to contact you. Pat yourself on the back for helping launch this podcast! Bravo, maestro!

Review on Android

1. Go to Score: The Podcast’s page on Stitcher: https://www.stitcher.com/podcast/score-the-podcast

2. Tap on the stars to rate the show and leave a review! (You may need to create an account to leave a review, if you haven’t already.)

3. Before pressing Send, take a screenshot of your review by pressing the Volume Down and Power buttons on your Android device at the same time (hold for 1 second). This is your proof of entry to win an autographed copy of SCORE: A FILM MUSIC DOCUMENTARY. (Be sure you remember to hit Send after!)

(Optional) 4. Tweet us your screenshot @ScorethePodcast. This way we’ll be able to contact you through Twitter, as the Stitcher app does not allow us to contact you. Pat yourself on the back for helping launch this podcast! Bravo, maestro!

Review on iTunes (Windows or MacOS X)

1. Open iTunes or click on this link: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/score-the-podcast/id1357882784.

2. Search for “Score: The Podcast” and look for the SCORE logo to appear.

3. Select Score: The Podcast, and then tap the Reviews tab. Tap Write a Review at the bottom.

4. Before pressing Send, take a screenshot of your review (on Windows, press Windows+PrtScrn or use the Snipping Tool; on Mac, Shift+⌘+4). This is your proof of entry to win an autographed copy of SCORE: A FILM MUSIC DOCUMENTARY. (Be sure you remember to hit Send after!)

(Optional) 5. Tweet us your screenshot @ScorethePodcast. This way we’ll be able to contact you through Twitter, as iTunes does not allow us to contact you. Pat yourself on the back for helping launch this podcast! Bravo, maestro!
